acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from ErC50=5.1mg/L of the algae (Green Algae) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2005).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >2,000mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1980)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat inhalation study reported the LC50 value of >2.04mg/L (4 hours) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1980)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 814mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1980)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in carcinogenicity studies in rats and mice (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1981, 1985)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (log Kow=3.6(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 2.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 116degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro studies (reverse mutation tests, forward mutation assay, chromosome aberration tests, DNA repair tests, unscheduled DNA synthesis tests) and in vivo studies (chromosome aberration tests on hamster bone marrow cells and rat dominant lethal tests in vivo) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1977, 1979, 1980, 1982, 2005)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine and oxygen (but not fluorine), with the chlorine and oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of "decreased female fertility," "dystocia," "decreased delivery rate," "prolonged gestation period" and "decreased pup viability" at doses causing reduced parental body weight gain observed in rat reproduction studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test method applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 116degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data), test temperature: 140degC).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild irritation of the eye, which was fully reversed by 72 hours, observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1977)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of irritation observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1977)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea pig sensitization tests employing the Maximization method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1980)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney, adrenal gland)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "fatty infiltration of the liver and hepatocellular hypertrophy," "renal tubular hyaline cast" and "hypertrophy of adrenal fasciculata cells" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1980)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "reduced locomotor activity," "blepharoptosis," "ataxic gait," "spastic gait," "sedation," "prone or lateral position," "panting" and "gasping" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1980)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.
